REUTERS.UNKNOWN: C T f0396 reute f f BC-SUGAR-TRADERS-FORECAS 04-01 0060

TEXT.TITLE: SUGAR TRADERS FORECAST LIKELY EC SUGAR REBATE
TEXT.BODY: London traders say the European Community is likely to award a maximum rebate of 46.80 European currency units per 100 kilos at today's tender, while traders in Paris predict a maximum award of 46.40 Ecus. Last week the EC awarded licences for 59,000 tonnes at a rebate of 45.678 Ecus. Trade views differed on the amount of sugar likely to be released today. London traders said the EC Commission will probably endeavour to release a large tonnage, and as much as 100,000 tonnes may be authorised for export under licences up to end-September. Paris traders put the likely tonnage at around 60,000. REUTER
